Package net.sf.appia.protocols.frag

This protocol fragments messages according to the lower layers maximum Protocol Data Unit (PDU) Size.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
FragConfig Interface FragConfig
To use this, just change the value of the specific variable and recompile this interface and the code that uses the variable.
 

Class Summary
FragEvent This event contains all the message fragments except the last one, sent with the original type.
FragLayer Layer component for the fragmentation protocol.
FragSession This is the Session class of the fragmentation protocol.
FragTimer  
MaxPDUSizeEvent This is the event that is used by the Frag protocol to learn the maximum Protocol Data Unit (PDU) size available for a channel.
 

Package net.sf.appia.protocols.frag Description

This protocol fragments messages according to the lower layers maximum Protocol Data Unit (PDU) Size.

Messages are splited in the following way:

  • all but the last fragment are sent on FragEvent events
  • the last fragment is sent with the original event type
upon reception, all but the last fragment are concatenated in the last one, and this one is the event sent to channel.

Headers contains two fields:

  • a unique msgid
  • a fragment number

This protocol does not provide reliability. If a fragment is received out-of-order, the whole message is discarded. In order to provide reliable delivery, a reliable protocol (like FIFO) should be provided bellow the fragmentation protocol.
